intro: Solanum brachystachys, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
